title: Getting started with CDCAtlas
code: library(CDCAtlas) df <- get_atlas(   disease   = "chlamydia",   geography = "state",   year      = 2022 )  head(df) #>   indicator year  geography    data_status        race_ethnicity        sex #> 1 Chlamydia 2022    Alabama Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #> 2 Chlamydia 2022     Alaska Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #> 3 Chlamydia 2022    Arizona Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #> 4 Chlamydia 2022   Arkansas Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #> 5 Chlamydia 2022 California Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #> 6 Chlamydia 2022   Colorado Not Suppressed All races/ethnicities Both sexes #>              age                transmission rate100000  cases population #> 1 All age groups All transmission categories      612.1  31060    5074296 #> 2 All age groups All transmission categories      727.7   5338     733583 #> 3 All age groups All transmission categories      554.4  40796    7359197 #> 4 All age groups All transmission categories      588.3  17918    3045637 #> 5 All age groups All transmission categories      493.6 192647   39029342 #> 6 All age groups All transmission categories      456.3  26646    5839926 #>   lowerci_rate upperci_rate rse lowerci_cases upperci_cases #> 1           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA #> 2           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA #> 3           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA #> 4           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA #> 5           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA #> 6           NA           NA  NA            NA            NA

title: Getting started with CDCAtlas
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(df, aes(x = geography, y = rate100000)) +   geom_col() +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Chlamydia Rate by State (2022)",     x = "State",     y = "Rate per 100,000"   ) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_col()`).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hemmige V (2025). CDCAtlas: package downloading CDC Atlas data R. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/VagishHemmige/CDCAtlas.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CDCAtlas: A package for downloading CDC Atlas data into R},   author = {Vagish Hemmige},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/VagishHemmige/CDCAtlas}, }

title: CDCAtlas
text: CDCAtlas provides polite, cache-aware R client selected CDC AtlasPlus endpoints. AtlasPlus stable, public API. package aims safe respectful usage: identifies via custom User-Agent applies rate limiting retry backoff caches responses reduce server traffic handles schema changes gracefully possible

title: CDCAtlas
text: can install development version CDCAtlas GitHub : install.packages(“devtools”) devtools::install_github(“VagishHemmige/CDCAtlas”)

title: CDCAtlas
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

what: Internal AtlasPlus request helper with caching — .request_atlas
title: Internal AtlasPlus request helper with caching — .request_atlas
Internal AtlasPlus request helper with caching — .request_atlas
Internal AtlasPlus request helper (uncached) — .request_atlas_internal
text: Low-level helper sends POST JSON payload AtlasPlus qtOutputData endpoint.

title: Internal AtlasPlus request helper (uncached) — .request_atlas_internal
text: Requires internal varvals lookup table factor labeling. Implements rate limiting user-agent headers API politeness.

what: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
title: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
text: get_atlas() provides programmatic interface CDC AtlasPlus platform, returning case counts, population denominators, rate estimates sexually transmitted infection (STI) surveillance. function submits payload AtlasPlus data endpoint parses response tidy tibble.

title: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
text: disease Character scalar. single disease name (e.g. "gonorrhea"). Multiple diseases currently supported single request. geography Character scalar. One "national", "region", "state", "county", "msa". year Integer vector years. Valid values 2000 2023. Can single year (e.g., 2022) sequence (e.g., 2018:2022). stratify_by Optional character vector. Zero, one, two "age", "race", "sex". NULL, totals (unstratified) returned. restrict_to Optional character vector restricting results specific states counties (case-insensitive). omitted, units geographic level returned.

title: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
text: tibble following columns: indicator Disease/condition name (factor) year Calendar year (numeric) geography Geographic unit name (factor) data_status Data quality flags (factor) race_ethnicity Race/ethnicity category (factor, stratified) sex Sex category (factor, stratified) age Age group (factor, stratified) transmission Transmission category (factor) rate100000 Incidence rate per 100,000 (numeric) cases Case count (numeric) population Population denominator (numeric) lowerci_rate, upperci_rate 95% CI bounds rate (numeric) rse Relative standard error (numeric) lowerci_cases, upperci_cases 95% CI bounds cases (numeric) Columns naming conventions may differ depending CDC schema changes. function attempts standardize guarantee historical compatibility years.

title: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
text: function supports multiple diseases, geographic levels, year ranges, optional stratification. Stratified queries expand results requested combinations (e.g., age race). possible, numeric fields returned double identifiers character. Supported diseases "chlamydia" "gonorrhea" "syphilis" Geography "national" "region" "state" "county" "msa" (metropolitan statistical area) Stratification CDC AtlasPlus API supports stratification one two dimensions: "age" "race" "sex" Stratification increases number returned rows. example, stratify_by = c("race", "sex") returns race × sex combinations geography-year pair. function reverse-engineered wrapper around AtlasPlus public query system. CDC publish official API specification, internal identifiers may change without notice. CDC modifies backend schema, requests may fail. Please report issues via GitHub.

title: Retrieve STI surveillance data from CDC AtlasPlus — get_atlas
code: if (FALSE) { # National gonorrhea rates for 2018–2022 get_atlas(disease = "gonorrhea", geography = "national", year = 2018:2022)  # State-level chlamydia, stratified by race get_atlas(   disease = "chlamydia",   geography = "state",   year = 2022,   stratify_by = "race" )  # Limit to specific states get_atlas(   disease = "gonorrhea",   geography = "state",   year = 2022,   restrict_to = c("NY", "CA", "TX") ) }
